sn2.2:4.2: Standing to one side, the god Kassapa recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn2.2:5.1: “Suppose a mendicant is one who practices absorption, freed in mind.
sn2.2:5.2: If they want to reach the heart’s peace,
sn2.2:5.3: having known the arising and passing of the world,
sn2.2:5.4: healthy-minded, independent, that is their reward.”
